snippet: A fishing war is straining relations between India and Sri Lanka, as Indian fishermen, often poor and desperate, regularly cross international waters and run afoul of the Sri Lankan Navy.
abstract: Vellapallam Journal; a fishing war is straining relations between India and Sri Lanka, as Indian fishermen, often poor and desperate, regularly cross international waters and run afoul of the Sri Lankan Navy; at least 100 Indian fishermen have been killed and 350 seriously injured in recent years, another example of the volatility of maritime issues in Asia.
lead_paragraph: A fishing war is straining relations between India and Sri Lanka, as Indian fishermen, often poor and desperate, regularly cross international waters and run afoul of the Sri Lankan Navy.

headline.seo: Sri Lanka and India Battle Over Fishing Grounds
headline.main: Two Hungry Nations Collide Over Fishing
headline.print_headline: Two Hungry Nations Collide Over Fishing
